title: Why is the US against communists and socialists? Is it the big corporates that have driven this policy ever since? - Quora
tags: Politics of the United States of America

response.answer_text: Democracy is a key component of a free Republic like the U.S., and communism (not in theory, but as inevitably practiced) was incompatible with being a democratic nation. Most free nations incorporate a form of socialism for those things private enterprise is bad at—fire departments, health care, public safety, etc. However socialism in the classic sense of government ownership of the means of production—is incompatible with American democracy.

The US is a Constitutional Republic and the Constitution forbids and autocratic state including both forms of socialism (communist and fascist). The Constitution was formed to get unhooked from the British for the purpose of personal and commercial liberty. The socialists will kill a lot of people to take over the USA, and that assumes the military supports the fascist or communist Democrats.
